events.name: Mainstreaming Blockchain, Crypto, Distributed Ledger & Decentralised Tech
events.description:
Mainstreaming Blockchain, Cryptocurrency, Distributed Ledger & Decentralised Technology: Where does the Community need to go next?
Monday August 27, 6.30pm - 9pm.
Refreshments will be served from 630pm, followed by presentations beginning at 7pm.
Event Description: CoinMarketCap aggregate value is down 70% from its peaks, but this down market is ironically the best time to revisit the mission of the decentralised, open source, blockchain, cryptocurrency and distributed ledger technology community.
We’ll present 5-minute executive summaries of some leading trends and projects in the blockchain and cryptocurrency industry, and our speakers will all address issues that must be improved for the mainstreaming of decentralised technologies. The audience size is capped at 200 attendees and is invite-only, priority to first responders. Invitees are curated from an exclusive group of impact investors, social entrepreneurs, Ethereum Singapore Community supporters, blockchain, open-source and cryptocurrency professionals and cross industry young leaders. 
Agenda: Speakers will present 5 minutes each, followed by a 30-minute Q&A panel discussion (Moderator: Dorjee Sun) with meet and greet networking and mixing before and afterward.


Allen Day (Developer Advocate, Google Cloud)New tools for greater clarity in cryptocurrencyAllen will describe a suite of new public tools and searchable public databases for Google Cloud users to gain greater insights and clarity from the Ethereum blockchain. 


Aya Miyaguchi (Executive Director, Ethereum Foundation)How Ethereum hopes to help and empower the mainstream usersAya will be discussing Ethereum's vision for helping, empowering and mainstreaming.


Dorjee Sun (Project Manager, Perlin)Crypto-economic incentives for the massesDorjee will present Perlin's vision to bring economic incentives to aid mainstreaming by renting their mobiles and under utilised compute devices as well as creating the marketplace that can direct benefit to cancer research, ocean big data computation and even forest conservation. 


Serena Tan (Partnerships, Santiment) Gender and Diversity in Cryptocurrency and Project Transparency: providing greater confidence in marketsSerena will share thoughts on how more women and gender equality could help both the culture and the mainstreaming of cryptocurrency, lessons on transparency from ProjectTransparency.org and how Santiment's tools have helped the Ethereum community move forward by extinguishing bad actors with greater transparency. 


Panel Discussion, 30 minutesDorjee will moderate an audience-driven Q&A panel
events.location: Google Singapore, 70 Pasir Panjang Road, #03-71 (Mapletree Business City Block 70, Level 3), Singapore 117371
events.group_name: Perlin.net - Ethereum Meetup Singapore - Google - Santiment

events.name: OneService Innovation Challenge 2018: OneMap Workshop
events.description:
The OneService Innovation Challenge 2018 (31 Aug - 2 Sep), organised by the Municipal Services Office (MSO) invites passionate innovators to co-create new services for the revamped OneService App, which will be a one-stop multi-functional platform aimed at fulfilling the municipal needs of neighbourhoods across Singapore.

At the OneMap Workshop (27 Aug), organised by the Singapore Land Authority, developers will learn how to easily call a rich variety of APIs - various base maps, comprehensive addresses, demographic data, multiple modes of routing, and functions like reverse geocodes and mini-maps. You will also be exposed to open source resources that they can leverage on to create your very own location-based applications.

OneMap is the authoritative national map of Singapore with the most detailed and updated information developed by the Singapore Land Authority. There are many useful day-to-day information and services contributed by various government agencies.

Learn more about the OneService Innovation Challenge 2018, especially the challenge statements, here.

We're organising more workshops to equip you with useful tools and resources to use at the Challenge weekend. Visit our Events page to learn more about these workshops and register for the OneService Innovation Challenge 2018.

If you have any questions, please send us an email at hello@upsingapore.com.
events.location: GeoWorks, 460 Alexandra Rd, PSA Building, #07-01, Singapore 119963
